articles.author: Gram Slattery, Andrew Mills, Federico Maccioni
articles.description: UAE leaders hope for U.S. help to make the Gulf nation a global leader in AI.
articles.title: Trump heads to UAE as it hopes to advance AI ambitions

articles.author: Steve Holland, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin will not attend what could be the first direct peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv in three years on Thursday, the Kremlin sending instead a group of experienced technocrats.
articles.title: Putin, Trump to skip Ukraine's peace talks that Russian leader proposed

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 60 people in the Gaza Strip, Palestinian medics said, as the United States and Arab mediators pushed for a ceasefire deal and U.S. President Donald Trump visited the Middle East.
articles.title: Israeli military strikes kill scores in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military killed five Palestinian militants in the occupied West Bank on Thursday, hours after a pregnant settler was killed in a shooting, as hardline pro-settler leaders including a government minister called for Palestinian towns to be razed.
articles.title: Israeli army kills five Palestinian militants in West Bank after pregnant settler killed

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The United States is likely to issue some sanctions relief to Syria in coming weeks following President Donald Trump's announcement that all sanctions targeting Damascus would be lifted.
articles.title: US preparing to issue some sanctions relief to Syria

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Donald Trump said that the United States was getting very close to securing a nuclear deal with Iran, and Tehran had "sort of" agreed to the terms.
articles.title: Trump says U.S. close to a nuclear deal with Iran

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations said on Thursday it will not take part in a U.S.-backed humanitarian operation in Gaza because it is not impartial, neutral or independent, while Israel pledged to facilitate the effort without being involved in aid deliveries.
articles.title: UN will not take part in US-backed aid effort in Gaza

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te offered his support and encouragement to the armed forces on Friday ahead of what the government has warned could be a new round of Chinese military exercises near the island from as early as next week.
articles.title: Taiwan president rallies the troops ahead of possible Chinese drills

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Defence Ministry said on Thursday that its forces seized two more settlements in their drive through eastern Ukraine, but Kyiv made no such acknowledgement and its top commander said battles raged over 1,100 km of the front line.
articles.title: Russia says forces capture two settlements, Ukraine says fighting continues throughout front

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The main Taiwan and U.S. trade representatives met in South Korea for trade negotiations, yielding optimism that further talks would lead to reduced U.S. tariffs on Taiwan exports, the island's Vice-Premier Cheng Li-chiun said on Friday.
articles.title: Taiwan meets with US for tariff talks in South Korea
